master.localization

Class USLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • master.localization.USLocalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Localizer

    public class USLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Localizer
    The USLocalizer performs localization for the EV3 Robot using an ultrasonic sensor. With the robot placed at an unspecified angle within a corner tile, the USLocalizer will rotate the EV3 robot until and latch the angles at which the sensor detects the walls with respect to the FALLING_EDGE technique discussed in class. Afterwards, it will the orientation to 0 degrees, and update the odometer.
    Since:
    2016-11-06
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jerome Marfleet, Yu-Yueh Liu

    • Constructor Detail

      • USLocalizer

        public USLocalizer(Odometer odo,
                   USPoller usPoller,
                   master.Navigation nav)
        This constructs
        Parameters:
        odo - - The robot's odometer.
        usPoller - - The ultrasonic poller corresponding to the sensor used for localization
        nav - - The Navigation class is required to move the robot.

    • Method Detail

      • localize

        public void localize()
        Performs the necessary angle localization according to the FALLING_EDGE angle correction. After, calls positionLocalization.
        Specified by:
        localize in interface Localizer

      • positionLocalization

        private void positionLocalization(int theta)
        positionLocalization is handles calculating the initial x and y position of the robot by measuring the distance of the robot and the walls of the corner. Because the orientation of the robot must be known beforehand, this method is set to private and only called on at the end of localize().
        Parameters:
        theta - - the orientation of the robot after localize() is performed

      • getFilteredData

        public double getFilteredData()
        Method acts a secondary filter for the USPoller, and is specific to the needs of the USLocalizer. In this case, the filter simply takes the minimum of the distance recorded, and our FILTER constant.
        Specified by:
        getFilteredData in interface Localizer
        Returns:
        The filtered distance from the USPoller, as a double.
